properties.otherAdvice:
High volumes of holiday traffic are expected approaching and through Blackheath, Mount Victoria and Lithgow during peak holiday travel periods.

For details about known holiday traffic pinch points, see the NSW Holiday and Journey planning website and the pinch point journey planning tool.

roads.mainStreet: Great Western Highway

properties.publicTransport: Tickets include travel on trains, metro and light rail. Buses replace trains between Lidcombe and Olympic Park on Saturday 10 and Sunday 11 January. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
United Cup Tennis at Ken Rosewall Arena at Sydney Olympic Park from Saturday 3 to Sunday 11 January. Day sessions start at 10.30am and night sessions from 5.30pm each day.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching Sydney Olympic Park as attendees travel to and from each session, and while other events take place in the precinct.  

Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Attendees who need to drive are encouraged to pre-book parking online ahead of time to secure a space, available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during events. For road closure details, view the interactive map.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.publicTransport: L1 Light rail services run regularly to Exhibition Centre and Paddy's Markets within walking distance of Tumbalong Park. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Sydney Symphony Under The Stars at Tumbalong Park in Darling Harbour. Event starts at 6.30pm, Orchestra performance starts at 7pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching and in Darling Harbour. Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity in the area.

Attendees are encouraged to catch public transport.

roads.mainStreet: Harbour Street

properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Macarthur FC v Sydney FC at Campbelltown Sports Stadium. Kick-off at 7.35pm, full time around 9.30pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual as fans travel to and from the match. Allow extra travel time on roads including Pembroke Rd, Rose Payten Dr and Leumeah Rd.

Motorists should also be aware of increased pedestrian activity in the area.

roads.mainStreet: Pembroke Road and Rose Payten Drive

properties.otherAdvice:
The Lumineers at Qudos Bank Arena. Show starts at 7pm, finish around 10.30pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual as fans travel to Olympic Park in the already busy weeknight peak.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on the M4, Parramatta Rd, Homebush Bay Drive, Silverwater Rd, Centenary Dr and Concord Rd. 

If you have to drive, carpool with your group pre-book your parking online ahead of time to secure a space – available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior. 

To get to your carpark and avoid the heavy traffic congestion expected at the Homebush Bay Drive roundabout, use Silverwater Road, Holker Street and Hill Road

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during the event. View the interactive map for closure details

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.otherAdvice: The TFW 9s competition will be held 8-10 Jan, 12-14 Jan & 16-18 Jan. Motorists are advised to follow signage, traffic control and be aware of increased pedestrian activity during the event.

roads.mainStreet: M1 Pacific Motorway

properties.otherAdvice:
NBL: Illawarra Hawks v NZ Breakers at WIN Entertainment Centre. Tip-off at 2.30pm, full time around 4.30pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching the Wollongong CBD and on local roads around WIN Entertainment Centre as fans travel to and from the match.

Local roads around the stadium may close before, during and after the game for the safety of pedestrians.

Fans driving to the game on the freeway are encouraged to use the Masters Rd exit to avoid congestion at Mount Ousley Rd, both in and out of Wollongong.

Motorists should allow extra time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Harbour Street

properties.publicTransport: Match tickets include travel on rail. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
BBL Cricket: Sydney Thunder v Melbourne Renegades at ENGIE Stadium. Start of play 7.15pm, end of play 10.15pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual as fans make their way to Olympic Park in the busy evening peak.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on the M4, Parramatta Rd, Homebush Bay Drive, Silverwater Rd, Centenary Dr and Concord Rd. 

If you have to drive, carpool with your group pre-book your parking online ahead of time to secure a space – available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior. 

To get to your carpark and avoid the heavy traffic congestion expected at the Homebush Bay Drive roundabout, use Silverwater Road, Holker Street and Hill Road

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during the event. View the interactive map for closure details

webLinks.linkText: NSW National Parks & Wildlife Service - Royal National Park local alerts

properties.otherAdvice:
The Royal National Park is expected to be busy over the Christmas and New Year holiday period between 22 Dec and 26 Jan.

Visitors are encouraged to check the Royal National Park local alerts before travelling for updates on precinct access.

Walking trails may also be closed due to total fire bans and/or risks, so plan ahead. 

Roads or car parks may close within the Royal National Park when they reach capacity.

The following locations may be affected:

  • Wattamolla Rd between Sir Bertram Stevens Dr and Wattamolla Beach car park
  • Bonnie Vale day use area
  • Garie Road between Sir Bertram Stevens Drive and Garie Beach car park
  • Maianbar Rd between Bundeena Dr and Maianbar township
  • Bundeena Dr between Sir Bertram Stevens Dr and Bundeena township

Traffic controllers and NSW Police will manage access for local residents, upon proof of address, at Maianbar Rd and Bundeena Dr.
properties.displayName: Royal National Park - Christmas & New Year holiday period

roads.mainStreet: McKell Ave, Farnell Ave and various roads

properties.publicTransport: Match tickets include travel on transport. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Western Sydney Wanderers v Newcastle Jets at CommBank Stadium. Kick-off at 5pm, finish around 6.55pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching the stadium as fans travel to the match. Allow extra travel time on roads including Parramatta Road, Church Street, Victoria Road, James Ruse Drive and Pennant Hills Road. 

Motorists should also exercise caution as pedestrian activity will be high on roads between Parramatta Interchange and the stadium. 

Be patient leaving car parks as traffic will be heavy and follow the directions of traffic controllers and Police.

roads.mainStreet: O'Connell Street

properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Central Coast Mariners v Macarthur FC at polytec Stadium. Kick-off at 6pm, full time around 8pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching the stadium as fans travel to and from the match.

Allow extra travel time and use local parking. 

Dane Drive will be closed from 4.45pm between the Central Coast Highway and Donnison Street and will reopen once crowds have cleared the area.

roads.mainStreet: Dane Drive

properties.otherAdvice:
January Cup Day at Rosehill Gardens Racecourse. First race at 12.20pm, last race from 6pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on James Ruse Dr and Hassall St as attendees arrive and leave the racecourse.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads in the area.

roads.mainStreet: James Ruse Drive

webLinks.linkText: International Test Match Australia v England

properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included in match tickets. Extra light rail services will run. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
International Test Match: Australia v England from Sunday 4 to Thursday 8 January at the Sydney Cricket Ground. Start of play daily at 10am and end of play daily at approx. at 5.30pm

With a sold out crowd of 45,000 expected each day ticketholders are urged to catch public transport and leave the car at home to avoid traffic delays and the high demand for parking. 

If you have to drive, carpool with your group and allow extra travel time as traffic will be heavier than usual as fans travel to and from the match.

Changed traffic conditions:

  • Driver Avenue will be partially closed outside the stadium from 6.30am and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area.  
  • No through-traffic will be available on Driver Avenue, however access to EP2 Kippax car park will be maintained via Moore Park Road and access to EP3 grass car park and drop-off areas maintained from Lang Road.
  • Special event clearways will be in place on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 6am to 7pm daily on sections of Albion Street, Fitzroy Street, Lang Road, Moore Park Road and on Cleveland Street.  

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

*Note: Albion Street, Fitzroy Street and Moore Park Road clearways in effect from 7am on Sunday 4 January

roads.mainStreet: Pacific Highway

properties.publicTransport: Ferries will be affected during the day and night due to exclusion zones on the harbour. Buses will also be diverting and using different stops due to road closures. Light rail will not run between Circular Quay and Town Hall from 7.30pm to 10.30pm. Visit transportnsw.info for details.
properties.otherAdvice:
Roads around Circular Quay, The Rocks and in Milsons Point will close during the day and evening for Australia Day events in the city and around the harbour.

Key road closure timings:

  • 4am to midnight – Circular Quay & The Rocks: Sections of Argyle St, Circular Quay West, OPT Elevated Rd, Essex St, George St, Harrington St and Lower Fort St 
  • 7am to 10am – Barangaroo & Millers Point: Sections of Barton St, Hickson Rd and Towns Pl
  • 7am to midnight – The Rocks: Hickson Rd* between Pottinger St and George St. *Note: No heavy vehicle access to Hickson Rd north of Pottinger St between 4am and 7am due to the closure of George St south of Hickson Rd and lack of turnaround area.
  • 10.30am to 1pm – Milsons Point: Olympic Dr between Broughton St and Alfred St South 
  • 7.30pm to 10.30pm – Sydney CBD North: Sections of Albert St, Alfred St, Circular Quay East, Conservatorium Rd, Loftus St, Macquarie St, Phillip St, Pitt St, Reiby Pl, Young St and other surrounding streets 
  • 7.30pm to 10.30pm – Cahill Expressway closed in both directions: including lanes 7 & 8 on the Sydney Harbour Bridge and the Circular Quay Overpass, the High St and Mount St on-ramps, on and off ramps at Macquarie St and the on-ramp at Domain Tunnel. Lane 4 on the Sydney Harbour Bridge will also close and the speed limit on the bridge will be reduced to 40km/h during this time. There will be no direct access from the Sydney Harbour Bridge to the Domain Tunnel. 
  • 9.15pm to 10.15pm – Sydney CBD North: Grosvenor/Bridge Street between Lang Street and Pitt Street  

The Cahill Expressway Circular Quay overpass walkway will be closed from 5pm to 9:30pm. The Sydney Harbour Bridge Walkway and Cycleway will remain open.

Special event clearways will be in effect on various roads in Circular Quay and The Rocks between 3am and midnight and throughout the CBD from 5pm until 10.30pm. Clearways will also be in effect on Olympic Dr between Broughton St and Alfred St South in Milsons Point from 9.30am to 1pm.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

arrangementElements.html:
DAWES POINT – FROM 4AM TO 10AM

  • Car park opposite Pier One from Hickson Rd to Hickson Rd

CIRCULAR QUAY / THE ROCKS – FROM 4AM TO 12 MIDNIGHT

  • Argyle St between Lower Fort St and Harrington St (eastbound)
  • Circular Quay West from George Street
  • Essex St between Harrington St and George St (eastbound)
  • George St* between Hickson Rd and Essex St
  • Elevated Rd from Hickson Rd to the end of the road (Overseas Passenger Terminal upper carpark)
  • Pitt St between Alfred St and Reiby Pl

*George St between Lower Fort St and Hickson Rd will be closed between 10pm Friday 23 January and 12 midnight on Monday 26 January for The Rocks Markets.

BARANGAROO / MILLERS POINT – FROM 7AM TO 10AM

  • Barton St between Barangaroo Ave and Hickson Rd
  • Hickson Rd between Napoleon St and Pottinger St*
  • Towns Pl between Dalgety Rd and Hickson Rd

*Local access to Pottinger St via Windmill St.

THE ROCKS – FROM 7AM TO 12 MIDNIGHT

  • Hickson Rd* between Pottinger St and George St

*No heavy vehicle access to Hickson Rd north of Pottinger St between 4am and 7am due to the closure of George St south of Hickson Rd and lack of turnaround area.

MILSONS POINT – FROM 10:30AM TO 1PM

  • Olympic Dr between Broughton St and Alfred St South

SYDNEY CBD NORTH – FROM 7:30 PM TO 10:30PM

  • Albert St between Macquarie St and Phillip St
  • Alfred St between Phillip St and Young St
  • Bulletin Pl from Pitt St
  • Circular Quay East from Alfred St at Phillip St (full loop)
  • Conservatorium Rd between Macquarie St and Cahill Exp (full loop)
  • Custom House Ln between Loftus St and Young St
  • Dalley St between Pitt St and George St
  • Loftus Ln between Young St and Loftus St
  • Loftus St between Bridge St and Alfred St
  • Macquarie St between Bridge St and Sydney Opera House roundabout
  • Phillip St between Bridge St and Alfred St
  • Pitt St between Reiby Pl and Bridge St
  • Reiby Pl between Loftus St and Pitt St
  • Underwood St between Pitt St and Dalley St
  • Young St between Bridge St and Alfred St

SYDNEY CBD NORTH – FROM 09:15PM TO 10:15PM

  • Grosvenor/Bridge St between Lang St and Pitt St

SYDNEY HARBOUR BRIDGE & CAHILL EXPRESSWAY – FROM 7:30PM TO 10:30PM

  • Bradfield Hwy Sydney Harbour Bridge - lane 4
  • Cahill Exp Sydney Harbour Bridge - lane 7 and 8
  • Cahill Exp Circular Quay overpass
  • Cahill Exp Conservatorium Rd on-ramp and off-ramp
  • Cahill Exp Domain Tunnel on-ramp
  • Cahill Exp High Street on-ramp
  • Cahill Exp Mount St on-ramp
  • Cahill Exp Warringah Fwy approach
arrangementElements.title: Road Closures

arrangementElements.html:
Special Event Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.


BARANGAROO / DAWES POINT / MILLERS POINT – FROM 3AM TO 10AM

  • Hickson Rd* between Napoleon St and Pottinger St

*Includes all parking: on both sides of the road and both sides of the centre median.

SYDNEY CBD – FROM 3AM TO 11AM

  • Clarence St* between Druitt St and Market St eastern side

*Authorised route buses excepted.

DAWES POINT / SYDNEY CBD / THE ROCKS – FROM 3AM TO 12MIDNIGHT

  • Argyle St between Harrington St and Lower Fort St (southern side)
  • Argyle St between Lower Fort St and Harrington St (northern side)
  • Circular Quay West From George St (full length of road)
  • Essex St between Harrington St and George St Northern Side
  • George St* between Lower Fort St and under SHB (Ped Crossing)
  • George St between Alfred St and Hickson Rd
  • Harrington St^ between Argyle St and Mission Stairs (eastern side)
  • Harrington St Between opposite Suez Canal and Argyle St (indented parking outside 55 Harrington St) (western side)
  • Hickson Rd** Between Pottinger St and George St
  • Pitt St Between Reiby Pl and Alfred St

*The Rocks Markets will close a portion of the road between Lower Fort St and Hickson Rd from 10:00pm Friday 23 January 2026 and 12 midnight on Monday 26 January 2026. Normal Rocks Markets clearway operations will be in in place. 

^Police vehicles excepted.

Oz Day 10K Wheelchair Race drop off and pick up until 11am.

**Includes all parking: on both sides of the road, both sides of the centre median, and carpark opposite Pier One.

SYDNEY CBD

FROM 9AM TO 6PM

  • Macquarie St* Sydney Opera House taxi rank (between carpark entry / exit) (eastern side)

* Vintage buses excepted.


FROM 9AM TO 10:30PM

  • Macquarie St* between Albert and Sydney Opera House Roundabout (western side)

*Notes:

Vintage buses excepted until 6pm. No exception for motorcycles or other vehicles to park in the special event clearway.

Accessible patron drop-off and pick-up excepted until 7:30pm when road closes; No parking.

Taxi drop-off and pick-up excepted until 7:30pm when road closes; No parking or ranking.

Rideshare drop-off and pick-up excepted until 7:30pm when road closes; No parking or dwelling.

MILSONS POINT – FROM 9:30AM TO 1PM

  • Olympic Dr between Broughton St and Alfred St South

SYDNEY CBD – FROM 5PM TO 10:30PM

  • Albert St between Macquarie St and Phillip St
  • Alfred St between Phillip St and Young St
  • Bent St between Phillip St and Loftus St
  • Bligh St^ between Bent St and Hunter St
  • Bridge St between George St and Macquarie St
  • Carrington St^ between Wynyard St and Margaret St (eastern side)
  • Circular Quay East from Alfred St – entire road loop including motorbike parking
  • Clarence St^ between King St and Margaret St
  • Conservatorium Rd from Macquarie St to Macquarie St - entire loop
  • Custom House Ln between Loftus St and Young St
  • Dalley St between Pitt St and end of road (George St)
  • Grosvenor St between George St and York St
  • Hunter St between Pitt St and Elizabeth St
  • Loftus Ln between Young St and Young St
  • Loftus St between Bridge St and Alfred St
  • Macquarie St between Bridge St and Albert St (western side)
  • Macquarie St* between SOH taxi rank and Conservatorium Rd (eastern side)
  • O’Connell St^ between Bent St and Hunter St
  • Phillip St between Bridge St and Alfred St
  • Pitt St between Reiby Pl and Bridge St
  • Reiby Pl between Loftus St and Pitt St
  • Spring St^ between Gresham and Pitt St (southern side)
  • Underwood St between Pitt St and Dalley St

arrangementElements.title: Special Event Clearways

arrangementElements.html:
Heavy & Oversize vehicles travelling north or south of the city are encouraged to use Victoria Road and the Gladesville Bridge to avoid traffic delays on the following detour routes in the city:

Cahill Expressway/Eastern Suburbs detour 7.30pm to 10.30pm:

  • All traffic and Oversize & Dangerous Goods vehicles travelling southbound on the Sydney Harbour Bridge will be detoured via York Street or the Western Distributor while the Cahill Expressway is closed.
  • Access to the Eastern Distributor (height limit 4.4m; no dangerous goods) will be via York Street, King Street, Elizabeth Street, Park Street and William Street to the Bourke St on-ramp.
  • Vehicles not carrying dangerous goods can use the Sydney Harbour Tunnel (height limit 4.4m), which remains open in both directions during the event.
arrangementElements.title: Heavy Vehicle Detour 7:30pm to 10:30pm

properties.otherAdvice:
BBL: Sydney Sixers v Hobart Hurricanes at the Sydney Cricket Ground. Start of play at 2.05pm and end of play at approx. 5pm.

Ticketholders are urged to catch public transport and leave the car at home to avoid traffic delays and the high demand for parking. 

If you have to drive, carpool with your group and allow extra travel time. Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching Moore Park as fans travel to and from the match, on roads including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Changed traffic conditions:

  • Driver Avenue will be partially closed outside the stadium from 11.30am and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area.  
  • No through-traffic will be available on Driver Avenue, however access to EP2 Kippax car park will be maintained via Moore Park Road and access to EP3 grass car park and drop-off areas maintained from Lang Road. Car parks open from 11am.
  • Special event clearways will be in place on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 11am to 7pm on sections of Albion Street, Fitzroy Street, Lang Road and Moore Park Road, and from 6am to 7pm on Cleveland Street.  

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

BBL: Sydney Sixers v Sydney Thunder at the Sydney Cricket Ground. Start of play at 7.15pm and end of play at approx. 10pm.

With more than 40,000 cricket fans expected at the Sydney Derby, ticketholders are urged to catch public transport and leave the car at home to avoid significant traffic delays and the high demand for parking. 

If you have to drive, carpool with your group and allow extra travel time. Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching Moore Park as fans travel in the already busy evening peak, on roads including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Changed traffic conditions:

  • Driver Avenue will be partially closed outside the stadium from 4.15pm and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area.  
  • No through-traffic will be available on Driver Avenue, however access to EP2 Kippax car park will be maintained via Moore Park Road and access to EP3 grass car park and drop-off areas maintained from Lang Road. Car parks open from 4.15pm.
  • Special event clearways will be in place on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 3pm to midnight on sections of Albion Street, Lang Road and Moore Park Road, and from 6am to midnight on Cleveland Street and Fitzroy Street.  

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

Ticketholders are encouraged to leave the car at home and catch public transport to avoid traffic delays and the high demand for parking.

If you have to drive, carpool with your group and allow extra travel time on roads including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Changed traffic conditions:

  • Driver Avenue will be partially closed outside the stadium from 2pm and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area.  
  • No through-traffic will be available on Driver Avenue, however access to EP3 grass car park and drop-off areas maintained from Lang Road. Car park open from 2pm. Note that EP2 Kippax car park will not open for this match.
  • Special event clearways will be in place on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 3pm to 9pm on sections of Albion Street, Fitzroy Street and Lang Road, and from 6am to 9pm on sections of Cleveland Street.  

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.otherAdvice: The festival will be held at Rotary Park from Wednesday 14 to Monday 26 January and will include stalls and shows over the course of the event. With an increase in pedestrians, motorists are advised to take note of traffic and event signage.

properties.publicTransport: Routes 166, 167 and 177 buses will divert or end trips early while roads are closed along the course. Visit transportnsw.info for more info and to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Thousands of participants are expected to take part in the annual Sun Run event. The 10km run starts at 6:30am and the 7km run starts at 7.30am, both from The Strand in Dee Why with both events finishing at Manly Beach by 10am.

Road closures, parking restrictions and changed traffic conditions will be in effect starting at 3:30am. All roads will reopen by 11am. 

Residents along the course are urged to plan ahead and relocate their vehicles outside the road closure footprint if vehicle access is required on event day. There will be limited vehicle movements permitted while the event is underway. 

ROAD CLOSURES

  • Dee Why – from 3:30am to 9am: sections of Howard Ave, The Strand and Dee Why Pde, The Oaks Ave westbound crossover will be maintained at The Strand until 6.15am.
  • Dee Why – from 5:15am to 9am: sections of Oaks Ave, Pacific Pde, Boronia St, Griffin Rd and Monash Pde will be closed.
  • North Curl Curl to Freshwater – from 5:30am to 9am: sections of Abbott Rd, Griffin Rd, Headland Rd, Pitt Rd, Adams St, Carrington Pde, Charles St, Evans St and surrounding local roads will be closed. Crossover points will be maintained on Pacific Pde at Griffin Rd, Playfair Rd at Pitt Rd, Ross St at Pitt Rd and Headland Rd at Griffin Rd until 6:15am.
  • Freshwater to Queenscliff – from 5:30am to 10am: sections of Lumsdaine Dr, Undercliff Rd, Dalley St, Dowling St, Greycliffe St, Queenscliff Rd and surrounding local roads will be closed. Managed westbound exit on Crown Rd between Dowling St and Cavill St from 5:30am to 6:30am and from 9:15am to 10am.
  • Manly – from 5:30am to 10am: sections of Bridge Rd, Cameron Ave and Collingwood St will be closed.
  • Manly – from 3:30am to 9:30am: sections of North Steyne, Raglan St, Collingwood St and other local roads will be closed.
  • Manly – from 3:30am to 11am: sections of South Steyne, Wentworth St, Ashburner St and Victoria Pde will be closed.

Special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect from 3am until 9am on roads along the course through Dee Why, North Curl Curl, Freshwater, Queenscliff and Manly, including on sections of Abbott Rd, Howard Ave, The Strand, Evans St, Crown Rd North Steyne and South Steyne.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

arrangementElements.html:
ROAD CLOSURES:

Road closures affect both directions unless stated otherwise. Roads will be progressively reopened when safe to do so.

CYCLEWAY CLOSURES

Cycleway closures affect both directions unless stated otherwise. Cycleways will be progressively reopened when safe to do so.

arrangementElements.title: Road Closures and Cycleway Closures

arrangementElements.html:
Vehicle cross overpoints have been established to facilitate resident access where possible. To ensure the safety of participants, these points will be closed to vehicles while runners pass through.

CROSSOVER POINT CLOSURE TIMES // Managed by Police & traffic controllers

DEE WHY

  • Oaks Ave westbound only - local access permitted until 6.15am
  • Pacific Pde at Griffin Rd (both directions) - local access permitted until 6.15am

NORTH CURL CURL

  • Headland Rd at Griffin Rd (both directions) - local access permitted until 6.15am
  • Playfair Rd at Pitt Rd (both directions) - local access permitted until 6.15am
  • Ross St at Pitt Rd (both directions) - local access permitted until 6.15am

CURL CURL

  • Adams St at Carrington Pde westbound only - local access permitted until 6.15am

QUEENSCLIFF

  • Crown Rd between Dowling St and Cavill St (both directions) - Managed exit permitted 5:30am - 6:30am, and between 9:15am - 10am. Road Closed 6:30am - 9:15am
  • Cameron Ave - managed exit until 6:30am

NO ACCESS LOCATIONS

  • DEE WHY & NORTH CURL CURL – residents between the course and the coastline will have no access while crossover points are closed.
  • CURL CURL & FRESHWATER – residents of cul-de sac roads off the western side of the course will have no access until roads reopen.
  • QUEENSCLIFF – residents between the course and the coastline have no access while crossover points are closed.
arrangementElements.title: Vehicle Access + Crossover Points

Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even for local residents or TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in signposted clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, use the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.publicTransport: Buses replace trains between Lidcombe and Olympic Park. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip and allow extra travel time.
properties.otherAdvice:
Yungblud at Qudos Bank Arena. Dune Rats from 8pm, Yungblud from 9.15pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual as fans travel to and from Olympic Park.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on the M4, Parramatta Rd, Homebush Bay Drive, Silverwater Rd, Centenary Dr and Concord Rd. 

If you have to drive, carpool with your group pre-book your parking online ahead of time to secure a space – available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior. 

To get to your carpark and avoid the heavy traffic congestion expected at the Homebush Bay Drive roundabout, use Silverwater Road, Holker Street and Hill Road

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during the event. View the interactive map for closure details

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.publicTransport: Buses replace trains between Lidcombe and Olympic Park. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip and allow extra travel time.
properties.otherAdvice:
NBL: Sydney Kings v Melbourne United at Qudos Bank Arena. Tip off at 4.30pm, full time around 6.30pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual as fans make their way to and from Olympic Park.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on the M4, Parramatta Rd, Homebush Bay Drive, Silverwater Rd, Centenary Dr and Concord Rd. 

If you have to drive, carpool with your group pre-book your parking online ahead of time to secure a space – available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior. 

To get to your carpark and avoid the heavy traffic congestion expected at the Homebush Bay Drive roundabout, use Silverwater Road, Holker Street and Hill Road

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during the event. View the interactive map for closure details.

webLinks.linkText: Sydney Festival – Live On Hickson Road

properties.publicTransport: Buses will divert while road closures are in place. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Sydney Festival – Live On Hickson Road: Efectos Especiales from 5pm to 10pm on Saturday 10 January in the Walsh Bay Arts Precinct.

With large crowds expected, the following changed traffic conditions will be in place on Hickson Rd to safely facilitate the event.

Road closures

  • From 1am Sat 10 to 2am Sun 11 Jan: Hickson Rd between Pottinger St and Towns Pl (south/westbound)
  • From 6am Sat 10 to 2am Sun 11 Jan: Hickson Rd between Towns Pl and Pottinger St (north/eastbound)

Motorists should expect traffic delays in the area while closures are in place. Follow the direction of traffic control, allow extra travel time and watch out for increased pedestrian activity in the area.

Special event clearway parking restrictions:

  • From 1am Sat 10 to 2am Sun 11 Jan: Hickson Rd between Pottinger St and Towns Pl (southern side and centre island)
  • From 4am Sat 10 to 2am Sun 11 Jan: Hickson Rd between Towns Pl and Pottinger St (northern side and centre island)

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

arrangementElements.html:
Traffic controllers will manage access at the following locations:

Pottinger Street at Windmill Street

  • For vehicles requiring access to Hickson Road northbound and George Street. This includes Pier One Sydney Harbour and Park Hyatt Sydney guests, business deliveries, and residential access.
  • All vehicles will exit via George Street southbound.

Wilson Parking - Bond One Car Park

  • Managed access during operating hours, from 6am to midnight on Saturday 10 January 2026.
arrangementElements.title: Managed Access

roads.mainStreet: Hickson Road
